Job_Description:
[DublinYour Role:
Data science lies at the heart of Tenable’s strategy meaning it will play a key role in our product portfolio in the months and years ahead. In 2017, Tenable established its Data Science Centre of Excellence in our Dublin office and we are expanding. We’re looking for talented data scientists to tackle some of the hardest problems in cyber security. So if you are passionate about Data Science, and ultimately seeing the benefits it brings to customers, then look no further than Tenable.
Your Opportunity:
Join a dynamic, innovative and fast-growing company to help shape the product pipeline
Work with product managers and researchers to develop end-to-end data science and machine learning solutions to address customer needs
Work with software engineers to design and develop production-ready models
Utilise Big Data technologies (Spark, EMR) to work on some of the biggest challenges in the cyber security industry
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
What You'll Need:
2+ years experience working as a Data Scientist or similar
Masters or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, maths, CS, physics)
Hands-on experience developing software or data products
Deep understanding of machine learning and statistics
Proficient with Python and data science stack (e.g. pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn)
Exposure to Big Data technologies
Experience with data visualisation tools
The ability to work independently and take ownership of projects
The ability to communicate results clearly and a focus on driving impact
And Ideally:
Knowledge of information security issues and trends
Familiarity with AWS or other cloud platforms (Azure, GCP).
Experience working in Agile environments (Scrum / Kanban)
 If you’ve reached this point in the job description and feel you’re still not sure if you should apply…Just do it! We know there are no perfect applicants. You may not have 100% of all those bullets listed above - and that’s okay. If you’re feeling like you’re not going to fit in with our teams - that’s not ok. We're One Tenable which means however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, we encourage you to submit an application if it’s a role you can be passionate about doing every day.

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.]

[DublinBy clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.
Job Description
JOB PURPOSE:
The student will act as a full-time member of the Business Excellence Team supporting all departments including manufacturing, engineering and quality. The successful candidate will be required to use of a mixture of multidisciplinary skills ranging from an intersection of mathematics, statistics, computer science, communication and business to gather, optimise, analyse and interpret data from a wide range of sources on the site to help us improve our processes. The student will also support the identification of opportunities to introduce digitisation to aid continuous improvement.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work in a team environment where you’ll collaborate with others and put your skills to use in areas such as:
Gathers and identifies local data analytics possibilities/initiatives/requests in collaboration with IT and site departments and global data analytics.
Supports and drives local data analytics initiatives, such as for Predictive Maintenance, Down Time Analysis and respective Database management.
Assist with the creation of Learning, Training and Development analytics.
Support local process monitoring and process improvement in collaboration with local and global teams (e.g. descriptive statistics and visualization, statistical process control, out-of-the-box-tools)
Supports and participates in global/functional/local data analytics community.
Participate fully in any cross functional training initiatives.
Drive and promote the corporate values of Takeda-ism within the workplace
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Working toward a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, mechatronics, data science, management information systems, or a related technical or business field.
RELEVANT EXPERIENCE:
Ability to manage multiple priorities independently and simultaneously.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal). Ability to excess ideas clearly and concisely.
SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:
Studying to achieve a university degree of computer science or equivalent with Mathematics, IT or Physics background with focus on e.g. Control Theory/ Statistics/
Mechatronics, Information/Operation, Technology, Innovation Management
Knowledge of
Digital/Big Data Analytics/ Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning
Signal Processing, Control Systems, Mechatronics
Statistical Process Control
Quality mapping of parameters is a plus
Bayesian statistics, Density estimation, Bayesian Hypothesis Testing
ANOVA and forecasting techniques (ARIMA, ARMA, NARX)
Experience in Machine Learning algorithms (CNN, SVM, LSTM, etc.),
Respective programming knowledge of either MATLAB/Python/R required, further skills such as C++, SQL etc. are advantageous
Hands-on, able to implement and execute initiatives
Good project management skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment, and the ability to cultivate and maintain positive business relationships; a well-motivated self-starter.
Effective problem solving, analytical aptitude, learn quickly and embrace change.
.
Locations
Grange Castle, Ireland
Worker Type
Employee
Worker Sub-Type
Paid Intern (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Full time

Qualifications

Job_Title: Junior Data Scientist - R&D Data Lab
Job_Description:
[DublinJob Description

My client is a global leader in their space are are undergoing major digital and technological transformation. Driving this is data and this group have developed a genuinely data driven culture across the business with access to VAST amounts of anonymised data.
We're looking for a data scientist with strong modelling skills and a strong problem solving acumen. You're someone who asks "why" and can connect the dots between business challenges and data realities, create useful models and delight, excite and engage stakeholders with your findings.

Qualifications

Predictive modelling (coming from heavy stats/ maths)
Regression Analysis
Propensity modelling (across large customer base datasets)
Strong scientific investigative approach (hypothesis analysis and testing)
Excellent data visualisation skills - we're open on platform
Knowledge of machine learning would be helpful for the future - however right now - this group are keen to advance their existing models and are always looking to build more!
Good communications skills (presenting, engaging with various business units)
A team player - you'll enjoy working with peers on projects - trusted to deliver the goods in your own way
This role may see you travel across Europe from time to time!
Additional Information

The opportunity
You'll join a small but mighty data team of c. 5people reporting into a strong commercial general manager (who is happy to handle the commercial part & continue to leverage buy in for data projects for you)
You'll build industry leading models servicing customer acquisition, marketing efforts and customer engagement as well as solve ad hoc challenges raised by business leaders
This is a big data environment
You'll have 3-4 years industry experience.
Adrian Clarke is Head of Analytics Recruitment at IT Search. Your application will be handled in strictest confidence & we will be happy to advise you on your career & direction in data analytics, data science, data technology or digital analytics.
Our client is an equal opportunities employer - however visa sponsorship is not available for this role.]

[DublinAbout us:
In the words of Inc Magazine “Web Summit is the largest technology conference in the world”. Forbes says Web Summit is “the best tech conference on the planet”, Bloomberg calls it “Davos for geeks”, Politico “the Olympics of tech”, and the Guardian “Glastonbury for geeks”.

Whatever Web Summit is it wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team of nearly 200 employees, including world class engineers, data scientists, designers, producers, marketers, salespeople, and more.

We’ve disrupted an old industry by building incredible software and designing mind-blowing events. We’ve revolutionised how people come together in our world. We started with one event: Web Summit. But now we’re creating category defining events all over the world, from Asia to North America.

And we’re just getting started.

About the team:
The content team communicates with our attendees and draws them to our events around the world. The team sits within the company’s wider marketing function. Working closely with advertising, email marketing, and the data science teams, we’re looking for someone to create and manage our written content to make it better and more targeted than ever before.

What you’ll achieve at Web Summit:

You'll write compelling content for our websites, sales collateral, emails, social media, newsletters, and blogs.
You’ll balance multiple priorities at a time, conceptualising and developing ideas and messages around business and marketing objectives.
You’ll review, proof and optimise outbound communication across all company platforms.
You’ll be a copy editor for several teams across the business, including our partnerships and speakers teams.
You’ll rise to challenging briefs and work closely with our design team to develop engaging campaigns.
You’ll be listened to. No matter how crazy your ideas seem!

Who you are:

You can write clear, persuasive, original copy. You’re an excellent communicator with an eye for detail.
You have a strong interest in content marketing and the world of technology. You're not just an excellent writer, you're a creative marketer. You understand the importance of A/B testing. You base your decisions on data and are able to test ideas and iterate quickly.
You have experience using different tools (email marketing tools, web content editing platforms, etc.) and a good understanding of SEO.
You’re invested in developing captivating content, finding new ways to engage with your audience, and capturing their interest.
You’re a creative at heart and are constantly thinking of new ideas to implement.

Skills and abilities we’re looking for:

Experience in digital copywriting and working to strict deadlines.
Outstanding writing and grammar.
Desire to be part of a fast-paced and varied business environment where flexibility is a must and you can adapt well to change.
Experience with email marketing platforms.

Be healthy, curious and social:

Stay healthy with our fully subsidised healthcare cover.
Exercise your mind and body with our free gym membership and yoga.
Enjoy our private garden

[https://blog.websummit.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/websummitgarden.jpg] right outside the office, complete with an orchard, sports equipment, and vegetables.

Enjoy an unlimited supply of fresh fruit, beverages, and cereals.
Master new skills from those around you, onsite talks, and training initiatives.
Become workmates, not just colleagues, with our active social calendar of company celebrations, trips abroad and sports.

*]

Job_Title: Data Scientist - LexisNexis Risk Solutions - Dublin

Job_Description:
[DublinThe Solutions team at AYLIEN is responsible for developing and delivering solutions that rely on AYLIEN's core product suite to solve our customers' specific needs. The Solutions team is responsible for delivering successful business solutions to some of our largest clients, as well as driving the customer-led innovation within our products. This team consists of Engineers, Data Scientists, Technical Account Managers and Project Managers.

AYLIEN is currently seeking a Data Scientist in the Solutions team who will be responsible for developing Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing capabilities to solve specific customer problems.

Responsibilities:

Development and delivery of Proof of Concepts for demonstrating ML/NLP-based capabilities to our customers.
Development and delivery of production-ready solutions in collaboration with the Solutions team.
Collaboration with product management across Platform, Data, and UI teams to continuously productize functionalities developed within the Solutions team that could be beneficial to a broader set of customers.
Engagement with external customers and Technical Account Managers within the Solutions team to gather requirements, propose solutions and seek feedback.
Collaboration and knowledge sharing with Research & Platform teams regarding best practices, processes, software tools, etc.

Requirements:

Relevant experience in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, or Data Mining.
Strong knowledge of at least one programming language, and general software engineering skills (experience with version control systems, deployment, containers, etc).
Strong knowledge of the scientific Python stack: NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.

Would be great if you have:

Experience with Deep Learning.
Domain knowledge and passion for the news and media intelligence, and/or the financial analytics & risk management industry.

]

[DublinData Scientist (Visualisation)
Nuritas is an artificial intelligence biotechnology company revolutionising the discovery of novel, natural and scientifically proven active peptides that can manage and improve human health. One of the highlights of working at Nuritas is the tight feedback loop between the data team and the R&D team working in the wet lab. This role seeks to further tighten that feedback loop by making analyses created by the data team more accessible and interactive, as well as making the results created by the R&D team more interpretable and interconnected. This role will be an interesting blend of one-off analyses of R&D experiments using your Data Scientist skillset and creating interactive visualisations based off these analyses in our Django-based webserver. You will also need to understand how to model the data in scalable databases so that not only are your visualisations more efficient, but our machine learning pipelines can be fed from the data structures you create. The ideal visualisations of our complex datasets will inspire new features for our machine learning models to make better predictions about all aspects of our business process, from manufacturing to the clinic to our bioactive peptides themselves. Job SummaryFirst and foremost, you will work closely with the lab scientists, analysing large data sets coming from proteomics, delivering insights and helping to make decisions using your data science skills. In addition to this, you will build scalable, interactive solutions to help scientists answer questions from the data. You will also work closely with machine learning experts to help design the next generations of our machine learning models using inspiration from your visualisations and/or unstructured machine learning methods. Responsibilities and dutiesPerforming analysis of complex big-data/'omics experiments e.g. proteomics, transcriptomics, or quality control to help R&D, manufacturing, and operations teams make decisions on Nuritas’ best disease treating/preventing active peptidesDesign and execution of interactive visualisations and dashboards for both technical and non-technical members of other departmentsDistil questions from the lab and operations to mathematical, programmatic, machine learning or data viz solutions and help identify opportunities to improve our processesDesign of database schemas for efficient storage and access of features for visualisations and machine learning modelsSkills and ExperienceMaster's Degree PhD in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physical Sciences, Life Sciences or related quantitative field (or equivalent industrial experience)Expertise in extracting, compiling and analysing complex datasets and providing insight and decisions to technical and non-technical collaboratorsExperience with biological data including any omics (any degree in a biological field is appreciated)Experience building web based interactive visualisations from complex data setsExperience with visualisation frameworks such as (ideally) python-based ones such as dash/plotly, bokeh, or altair; other languages such as D3.js or Rshiny; or software such as Tableau or Power BIKnowledge of web frameworks such as django, rails, or flaskFamiliarity with SQL and/or NoSQL database technologies, ideally experience in database designFamiliarity with machine learning techniques an advantage
To discuss this exceptionally exciting opportunity that we are recruiting here in Nuritas please contact Mark Tierney, Talent Acquisition Manager by submitting an updated CV for consideration.]

[Sandyford, County DublinFull-time, PermanentFounded by Mastercard and IBM, Trūata offers a new approach to handling data anonymization and analytics to help organizations meet the standards of personal data protection envisioned by the GDPR. Trūata offers its customers a service to fully anonymize algorithms and reports that customers can use in their own products and solutions. The trust is based in the Republic of Ireland.Trūata is recruiting for a data scientist to join the research and operations team in Dublin, Ireland.As a Data Scientist, you will be building the next generation of privacy software to identify and mitigate privacy risks while delivering analytic value. This will involve core research, prototyping and evaluation, understanding and implementing customer requirements. We are an IP-centric organization so the techniques you will be developing will be novel and unique. We pride ourselves in delivering the best and to do that we hire the best. You will be a member of a highly skilled cross-disciplinary technical team designing and building a platform to enable enterprises to perform analytics on their customer data in a GDPR-compliant way.This position reports into Trūata’s Chief Data Scientist._The Role: _**· Core research on critical topics relating to anonymity, encryption, privacy and risk management, i.e. differential privacy, homomorphic encryption, etc.· Understand business objectives and customer requirements· Suggesting and contributing to initiatives to develop new tools and technologies· Development of literature reviews / market landscape reports· Development of tools to enable automated analysis of data risk reports· Identification of risk assessment tests and configurations based on internal analysis and state of the art reviews.· Development of algorithms to implement required privacy enhancement controls· Development of machine learning and predictive analytics models using anonymised customer data to support their key business requirements.· Large-scale evaluation of effectiveness of Truata anonymisation techniques and machine learning models developed for customers.What you need: · PhD degree in a related discipline (computer science, statistics, data analytics, privacy)· Applied knowledge (2+ years) in related programming environment (Python/Jupyter, Scala/Spark, R, etc)· 2+ years of industry experience in a relevant role· Practical experience using machine learning and analysis techniques (clustering, regression, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc) and their real-world advantages, drawbacks and ideal usage scenarios.· Excellent analytical and statistical analysis skills.· Experience with manipulating and analyzing data using dataframes, pivot tables, visualization tools.· Experience working with and creating data architectures.· Direct experience with the entire data science project lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design, implementation, evaluation and presentation of results.· Ability to present technical concepts and results clearly to different audiences and stakeholders.Preferred skills and qualifications: · Experience in data privacy, GDPR compliance and risk management· Working knowledge of Big Data technologies including Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, Kafka, Redis, Hive, Impala· Experience with cloud infrastructure providers (AWS/Azure)· Excellent experience with data partitions and transformation, and in-memory computations (large-scale join / groupby / aggregations)· Experience designing and building large scale Spark applications and data pipelines, monitoring and optimizing Spark job performance.· Customer requirements gathering and KPI reporting / presentation of data science project outputs.· Industry experience in relevant vertical such as financial services, travel / hospitality, telecom, insurance, healthBenefitsWe take pride in offering an energetic and contemporary employee experience, supported by and array of benefits that provide our employees and their families with flexibility, quality and value. These include excellent health insurance, contributory pension scheme and free lunches!Trūata is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws regulations and ordinances.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Industry: 1 year (Preferred)Education:PhD (Required)]

[DublinData Engineer (19000DSL)
PRIMARY LOCATION : IRELAND-LEINSTER-DUBLIN
ORGANIZATION : AXA Ireland
CONTRACT TYPE : Regular
SHIFT : Day Job
SCHEDULE : Full-time

DESCRIPTION

We are recruiting a Data Engineer to join our Data Analytics team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a dedicated analytics team working with multiple areas across the business. The area has the responsibility to deliver insights and data driven solutions for internal customers across multiple areas (Claims, Customer, Marketing, etc.).

ABOUT THE PERSON
Interact closely with data scientist to design and implement data-driven solutions
Automate and industrialise repetitive data integration steps, pre-cleaning data used by data scientists to prepare and apply machine learning models.
Work closely with the business to understand their problems and operational needs. Gathering, interpreting and prioritising their requirements
Work closely with IT to identify, collect, explore and understand the data required to meet business needs.
Solve data-related problems within the team and implement efficient data pipelines
Maintain data pipelines, measuring performance and ensuring good data quality in place by implementing adequate monitoring.
Contribute in company data transformation and technological transformation.
Job Advert to be added

QUALIFICATIONS

Degree+ in Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Sciences.
4+ years development experience in Data Engineering, Big Data, Data science or ETL.
Proficient in SQL development and dealing with relational databases.
Knowledge of R or Python is a plus
Experience working in an agile environment desired
End to end project lifecycle experience from concept to delivery and support.
Good understanding of machine learning models and data science process (feature engineering, modelling, etc.) is a strong plus.
Experience using API’s is a plus
Experience extracting data from unstructured data sources (text, images, audio, ..) is a plus
Autonomous, innovative, pragmatic
Detailed oriented, problem-solver and solution focused with proven ability to deliver, prioritising and organising work load.
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
Ability to work with transactional data coming from multiple integrated systems (Data warehouse, Legacy systems, CRM system, third party operational systems, Api’s ..)
Able to apply analytical problem solving, make recommendations, and implement improvements continuously in a dynamic environment.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams
Communicate clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audience
Writes quality and reusable code using software development process and version control.
Team worker with responsibility & accountability for their own work.
Demonstrate a continuous appetite for learning new techniques, languages or tools.
ABOUT AXA

Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.


Proud to be part of the AXA Group, at AXA Ireland our values are at the heart of everything we do. We work together as One AXA, embracing our differences to make our teams great. We believe integrity, courage and our customer-first approach is what makes us a great place to work.

WHAT WE OFFER

[DublinSenior Data Scientist
Everything you need, everywhere you need it! Microsoft 365 brings together the best-in-class productivity of Office 365 with simple device management and security to connect people and information in an intelligent new way. The Customer Success Engineering (CSE) GLOBAL Team’s mission is to offer our customers the best possible connected language and international AI experiences, improve productivity and foster a culture of collaboration through M365. Our focus is on delivering the best possible international customer experience, with locally relevant language and AI solutions.

Our Global Data Science team works closely with our International teams to help understand our customers experience and satisfaction with our M365 products. The team builds models, runs experiments and completes deep analysis to understand how we can make the international customers experience better and more relevant to their market and the language in which they wish to use our products.

Our Data Science team work with product teams to identify actionable insights to help our Office and Windows customers achieve more, and leveraging machine learning to accelerate customer success. Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Design and lead large scale analytical efforts that impact the business
Mine and engineer data from large and varied data sets (structured/unstructured)
Research, evaluate, implement, and present statistical methods to provide actionable customer focused insights.
Develop strong collaborative working relationships with our PM Leadership and Engineering PM’s.
Communicate and evangelize methodologies and findings of business analyses to multiple levels of leadership across partner teams.
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products.

A Master’s degree or PHD in Computer Science, Mathematics or a Data Science related discipline.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with hands on experience working with large datasets.
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
Excellent communication, collaboration, organization and business partnership skills required.]

[DublinAbout us:
In the words of Inc. magazine, “Web Summit is the largest technology conference in the world”. Forbes says Web Summit is “the best tech conference on the planet”, Bloomberg calls it “Davos for geeks”, Politico “the Olympics of tech”, and the Guardian “Glastonbury for geeks”.

Whatever Web Summit is it wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team of nearly 200 employees, including world class engineers, data scientists, designers, producers, marketers, salespeople and more.

We’ve disrupted an old industry by building incredible software and designing mind-blowing events. We’ve revolutionised how people come together in our world. We started with one event: Web Summit. But now we’re creating category-defining events all over the world, from Asia to North America.

We’re just getting started. [https://youtu.be/shSLieOZxjc]

About the team:
We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing Data Science team at Web Summit, to build out our data platform and deliver key data services for our internal users. The team builds custom data pipelines, data models, and dashboards, and manages all the underlying infrastructure.

You will work closely with end-users to help them get insights and automate parts of their deliverables across all our conferences: Web Summit in Lisbon, RISE in Hong Kong and Collision in Toronto.

What you’ll achieve at Web Summit:

You’ll work closely with the Data Science team to build data products for Web Summit teams.
You’ll work across our data stack (Python, Presto, Superset and Metabase) to deliver quality, maintainable and reliable data products that support decisions for the best conferences in the world.
You’ll collaborate and learn with other team members via mentoring, code reviews, and technical talks.
You’ll learn about and champion best practices in code, architecture and development processes.

Who you are:

You have an analytical mind and love solving problems.
You care deeply about data engineering culture and the quality of products you and your team build.
You love working with data and new technologies.
You’re knowledgeable in a broad spectrum of products and recent developments, and can make informed choices about technologies to be adopted.

Skills and abilities we’re looking for:

2+ years of experience in writing SQL queries.
2+ years of experience in designing and building data warehouses.
Ability to understand large, complex distributed systems with many moving, interrelated parts.
Comfortable working in Scrum/Kanban environment, with Git Pull/Code reviews.
Experience working with AWS a benefit

Be healthy, curious and social:

Stay healthy with our fully subsidised healthcare cover
Exercise your mind and body with our free gym membership and yoga
Enjoy an unlimited supply of fresh fruit, beverages, and cereals
Master new skills from those around you, onsite talks and training initiatives
Become workmates, not just colleagues, with our active social calendar of company celebrations, trips abroad and sports

]

Experience in the Cosmetic Industry will be advantageous
High Proficiency in Microsoft Office Packages
Strong organisational & administrative capability with proven ability to prioritise and deal effectively with workload, as well as being able to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines

And, importantly, we recognize their efforts and reward their achievements.

[Dunboyne, County MeathThe facility at Dunboyne will manufacture enzyme replacement and antibody-based therapies for Shire, the leading global biotech company focused on rare diseases. The role of MS&T Scientist will provide technical expertise to manufacturing operations and new product introduction at our new state of the art, single use multi-product biotech facility in County Meath, Ireland.
Key responsibilities of the MS&T Scientist across upstream and downstream biologic's include; devising and executing process optimisation studies to support manufacturing efficiencies, management of new product introduction activities, completion of product robustness monitoring in partnership with global technical teams and the provision of leadership for investigations.
This role will ensure all aspects of the Dunboyne culture including commitment to safety, right first time in everything we do and a focus on the engagement and development of employees. The position will provide technical leadership for biologics manufacturing, support optimisation of processes, including supporting laboratory scale studies. The Scientist will contribute to technical assessments on new products in partnership with global technical teams, providing input to product strategy.
Responsibilities:
SAFETY
Act as a role model for safety; you have a duty of care to yourself, your colleagues and the public to report any unsafe conditions and near misses at the time they occur.
Be knowledgeable of emergency procedures in your area and across the site
Perform safety audits, walk downs and safety investigations
Build safety as a value within every aspect of the operation that supports manufacturing and sustains Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) programmes at the site.
Ensure all manufacturing science and technology personnel adhere to safe working practices at all times
To participate in process hazard and operability studies, conduct risk assessments and ensure appropriate safeguards are identified and associated actions are addressed.
Responsible for ensuring compliance with legal, EHS and all Shire policies and procedures which are applicable to the site.
PEOPLE:
Ensure all team members are working as one team to support the delivery of product to patients.
Coach scientists and engineers within the team to build technical capability.
Be responsible for the scientific skills matrix to drive a learning and development organisation as well as maximising flexibility across the team.
Support the creation of a high performing organisation through implementation of a robust learning and development plan for the Manufacturing Science and Technology team.
Celebrate with use of proactive recognition tools that inspire teams and individuals
Be an ambassador for the Shire leadership behaviours of accountability, be positive, results driven and excellent manager of self and others.
Role model the behaviours that create a culture of respect and dignity in line with the Shire Guide to ethical conduct
Responsible for the goal setting, ongoing performance reviews and development planning within the Manufacturing Science and Technology Organization
Represent Dunboyne Plant internally and externally to promote Shire Dunboyne and to support delivery of benchmark site performance.
OPERATIONS:
Key position on the interface between the project and technology transfer team to ensure the Bioprocess Laboratory will operate in accordance with user requirements and meet the key project milestones.
Define, coordinate and drive completion of upstream and downstream technical work packages with functional representation (cell culture, chromatography, UF/DF, filtration and drug substance bulk fill).
Provide technical input to meet Project timelines for design, facility start up, process validation and CMC product registration.
Drive Technology Transfer activities for new products and ensure the bioprocess laboratory is set-up to support process monitoring and continuous improvement.
Operations:
Provide technical expertise and oversight within the manufacturing science and technology team, with a clear understanding of GMP and Safety expectations, to ensure the delivery of product to patients, in partnership with manufacturing.
Act as the technical expert to support new product introduction and continuous innovation.
Provide technical ‘hands on’ leadership to new product introduction for flawless launch and execution.
Devise and conduct process optimisation studies within the bioprocess laboratory at our state of the art Dunboyne Facility.
Conduct literature searches and develop proposals to support process changes, working as subject matter expert and as part of a team.
Interpret data from optimisation studies and provide analysis in support of conclusions.
Identify innovation opportunities and partner closely with manufacturing, quality and safety in the implementation of improvements and in the monitoring of manufacturing performance.
Lead activities for process optimisation, including yield improvement and cycle time reduction.
Develop the Product Robustness Monitoring Plan and contribute towards global product reviews.
Maintain a register of process risks based on trend analysis and communicate openly within technical teams to address.
Coordinate change control activities to ensure proposed process improvements are planned and implemented effectively
Evaluate new technologies that add value to both laboratory and site operations Develop and maintain expertise in technology transfer, process robustness, improvements and investigations.
Be recognized as subject matter expert for data analysis and management in order to build process knowledge
Lead and drive CAPA investigations in accordance with the Shire Global Investigations Process
Present investigation findings to regulators and demonstrate technical depth in defending the outcome
Contribute to regulatory authoring and strategy for new product introduction and post approval changes, ensuring appropriate technical input is provided.
Provide process training to laboratory and value stream functions to support new product introduction and commercial manufacturing.
Develop technical process documentation for all products manufactured at the site, ensuring alignment with plant operations for successful implementation
Lead and / or provide technical input to ensure the delivery of Business Excellence initiatives.
Demonstrate proficiency in the use of Operational Excellence tools and techniques
Participate in companywide teams, programs and external networks to develop technical capability within the organization
Provide process expertise to the manufacturing and engineering teams for delivery of projects from concept to implementation phases.
Develop and maintain project and program management capability within manufacturing science and technology
Provide input on process parameters to support validation activities for new product introduction and commercial manufacturing
Play a key role in delivering the start-up plan for the site, acting as an area SME during the handover process from commissioning through into qualification and process validation.
Education and Experience Requirements
Ph.D. with min. 1 year of experience (scientific discipline in biotechnology, biochemistry, pharmacy, process engineering or equivalent)
Technical expertise with Biologics drug substance upstream and downstream purification, process development and/or manufacturing operations is highly desirable
Experience of team membership or lead of process technology transfers for clinical/commercial biologics
Experience with project management and/or leadership enabling cross functional engagement to deliver project goals and timelines.
Experience of laboratory design in a start-up is desirable
Experience in leading investigations is desirable
Accredited Lean/six sigma/DMAIC competency is desirable.
Accredited Project Management competency is desirable.
Key Skills, Abilities, and Competencies:
Effective communicator and deep technical expertise in science
Understanding of bioprocess laboratory operations and process development
Understanding of Quality by Design (QbD) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) to enable right first time Process Performance Qualification (PPQ)
Excellent knowledge of statistics and DOE principles to drive continuous process verification in manufacturing and across the network
Proven ability to contribute towards process changes and to support new product introduction, applying knowledge of risk assessment tools and the Quality system
Technical leadership skills to explain and simplify complex information for others in support of business decisions
Proven skill to develop practical options in support of decision making
Ability to lead others to solve problems and take new perspectives on existing solutions
A proven ability to lead a team and promote a culture where diversity and inclusion is supported
Strong coach to build technical capabilities within the team
Excellent trouble shooting and problem-solving skills
Excellent influencing, collaboration skills and team working ability to represent manufacturing science and technology on global and interdisciplinary teams
Stakeholder management skills to collaborate across site and global teams
Ability to challenge the status quo with a continuous improvement mind-set
Proven ability in the use of lean tools and in building capability across teams to set clear standards in how work is done
Complexity and Problem Solving:
Incumbent’s authority to make as well as those decisions that must be referred to a higher level.
Identifying and communicating risks in delivery of the manufacturing schedule
Communicating decisions and risks related to the technology transfer of new products
Acts as an advisor / lead for the resolution of technical investigations, presenting options to leadership for endorsement of decision, as appropriate.
Exercises judgment when recommending a course of action to support manufacturing operations, including clear communication and alignment with the manufacturing team
Makes a balanced assessment of risk for process optimization projects, with the right stakeholders informed of the approach taken.
Develops Process and Cleaning Validation criteria to ensure product quality requirements are met, leveraging development studies and the established design space.
Evaluates the input and output from self-directed teams in manufacturing, providing requisite technical resources to support the schedule and / or optimization projects.
Internal and External Contacts:
Collaborate with other site PDTS Functional Groups (Product Lifecycle, CMC, QbD/Validation, Process & Analytical Development)
Collaborate with Product teams (TOPT/CMC) to ensure Product Lifecycle/ process changes improvements are fully assessed, endorsed and implemented to sustain patient supply.
Collaborate with Manufacturing Operations on process and cleaning validation, performance trend monitoring, and investigations and in the delivery of improvement opportunities.
Collaborate with Quality and EHS with regard to investigations and change controls impacting on manufacturing. Collaborate with Quality to foster a right first-time culture in support of quality excellence.
Collaborates with EHS and is accountable to drive a culture of everyone owns safety
Collaborates with Engineering for all change controls, investigations, continuous improvement and projects related to the process equipment operating parameters. Providing requisite technical specifications, as appropriate.
For Automation, establish process requirements to allow optimal operating parameters to be defined for manufacturing operations and in making process improvements.
Partner with Supply Chain to ensure effective product lifecycle management. Provide input to ensure long term capacity assessments and product / plant fits are completed in line with master planning.
For continuous improvement, collaboration with Business Excellence and peers across the Biologics business unit in Shire and through external forums to drive business excellence in processes/ manufacturing.
Collaborates with Regulatory Affairs to ensure process changes are in compliance, while supporting submission generation and response requests from health agencies.
Collaborates with CRO/CMO labs to design and execute development studies.

Amgen Job Description: The Sr Engineer provides process development technical support to large molecule and small molecule drug product manufacturing at ADL as well as being part of the global Process Development organization. The input provided will include support of process performance and implementation of process improvement strategies:
Acts as a drug product manufacturing technical expert to provide solutions when troubleshooting issues in drug substance freezing/thawing, formulation, filling vials/syringes/devices, lyophilization, inspection, and transportation, for parenteral products.
Provides process development expertise for commercial drug product processing in specific areas such as Sterile processing, Process Characterization, Tech Transfer and Validation. Supports commercial drug product manufacturing operations with technical evaluation of NC/CAPA and technology transfer. Adopts a customer-centric interface with manufacturing, and all partner support functions, to provide robust and coordinated support to manufacturing.
Troubleshoots issues with drug product processing technologies and equipment. Champions use of data-driven analyses and visualizations. Investigates to determine true root cause.
Develops and characterizes drug product processes and transfer technology to commercial drug product sites.
Conducts risk assessment for drug product operations and propose / implement appropriate CAPA.
Identifies and implements operational opportunities for current and new sterile operations.
Responsibilities may include leading cross-site teams to support the above activities, providing recommendations to management. Be a link to manufacturing on key investigations as a process expert.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree & 10 years of directly related experience
OR
Master’s degree & 6 years of directly related experience
Associate’s degree & 15 years of directly related experience
Preferred Qualifications
Masters in Science or Chemical Engineering
10 + years of experience in support of Commercial Protein Drug Product (DP) processing in specific areas such as Sterile Processing, Process Characterization, Tech Transfer (to commercial DP sites) or Validation.
Strong skills in applying fundamental engineering and scientific principles to the design and implementation of protein freeze-thawing, filtration, mixing, filling, and/or lyophilization processes. Knowledge of protein biochemistry with regard to chemical and physical stability
Project management skills including the ability to manage multiple projects and evaluate project resource requirements.
Strong knowledge of Quality systems, Drug Product Manufacturing and Validation.
Demonstrated ability in providing leadership to cross-functional teams to advance complex projects to completion. Excellent Communication skill are essential for this role, as well as a demonstrated proficiency with the principles of Technical Writing.
Join Us
If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.
Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.
As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

[DublinBNY Mellon – Data Scientist - Advanced Digital Solutions

Who we are
For over 230 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $15 billion in revenues and market capitalization of approximately $50 billion

BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:

Managing the custody of over $31 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing over $1.8 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals in our top 10 wealth manager ($250 billion assets)
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers (over $1.8 trillion in client assets)
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers (over $4.7 trillion)

In addition, BNY Mellon is a strategic partner to a variety of financial technology companies and a convener of influential industry and market structure forums.

What we are doing
Chairman & CEO Charlie Scharf recently announced the launch of a newly formed global digital team, led by Roman Regelman, a former BCG partner who drove a number of large scale digital transformations for global financial services clients. The Digital team drives BNY Mellon’s core digitization strategy and is responsible for mapping our digital future, investing in digital client and internal capabilities, including data management, analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and robotics.

The Digital team focuses on maximizing investments in our digital capabilities to drive significant improvements in business performance and the client and employee experience. The team is accelerating the bank’s innovation strategy, developing more cross-functional integration and mining best practices to integrate across businesses, regions, front line relationship managers, innovation centers. We are currently looking to fill positions at our global headquarters in Tribeca, New York

Role responsibilities
As a member of the Advanced Digital Solutions team, the primary focus and responsibilities will be to deliver tangible value and advance the digital agenda across the enterprise by accelerating effective use of AI. Main responsibilities will include:
Serving as AI solutions expert to address critical business needs in partnership with business teams, digital team members and technology. This includes designing and delivering proofs of concept as required.Providing guidance on AI capabilities – available internally or in the market place – to determine best path forward factoring in feasibility, maturity of solutions, cost, time to market etc.Driving the use of shared library / repository and model management of AI solutions across the enterpriseDriving / promoting best practices on effective use of AI solutionsSupporting lines of business and functions in developing AI capabilities to drive scale
Qualifications
Advanced Degree in Math, Science / Engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.

Preferred Qualifications:
An AI practitioner with hands on experience in designing and deploying machine learning solutionsExcellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, NumPy, MatLab, etc.Experience with data visualization toolsProficiency in using query languages and databasesApplied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.Entrepreneurial and results orientedExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsAble to deal well with uncertainty and unstructured problems to be solvedAble to work across businesses and functions at all levelsAble to lead ad-hoc and structured teams for achieving goals within established time parametersExcellent interpersonal skills necessary to accomplish goals through others, including employees, peers, and other function/business areas of the company10-12 years of related experience preferredExperience in the securities, financial services, or asset management industry a plusGraduate degree from top universities a plus

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Job_Title: Senior Data Scientist - Generative Chemist, AI Innovation Lab
Job_Description:
[DublinTwo companies and one incredible alliance!

Novartis and Microsoft have formed an alliance to utilise data & Artificial Intelligence (AI) in order to develop transformative medicines faster and more cost-effectively for patients worldwide.

We are seeking an inspiring leader and team builder to join the Novartis Innovation AI Lab to advance the field of Life Science and healthcare analytics.

In this newly formed alliance with Microsoft, you will lead Biochemistry / Pharmaceutical Chemistry data science efforts.

Your responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Lead data science efforts to develop novel compound suggestions to Novartis’ medicinal chemistry teams.Take a hands-on role to deliver on multiple highly visible data science projects.Serve as an ambassador for Novartis Data Science by presenting and publishing articles at conferences, business meetings and academic institutions.Facilitate design and creation of knowledge repositories, keeping ahead of the latest development in the field.Collaborate with the Digital and Data Science and Artificial Intelligence teams and inspire others on culture change.
Minimum requirements
What you’ll bring to the role:

An advanced degree (master’s or doctoral) in a highly quantitative field including but not limited to Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Biomedical Engineering, Computational Physics, Chemistry.English - Fluent written and spoken.Three or more years of relevant thought leadership experience in applying deep learning on knowledge graphs.A proven track record of communicating and partnering with senior stakeholders to deliver scalable global solutions.Experience conducting end-to-end analysis for large scale healthcare data sets.

Desirable requirements:

Previous experience in either pharma, biotech or healthcare desired.

You’ll receive:

Competitive salary, Annual bonus, Pension scheme, Share scheme, Health insurance, 25 days annual leave, Flexible working arrangements, subsidised dining facilities, Employee recognition scheme, and learning and development opportunities.

Why consider Novartis?

750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Novartis Ireland Ltd. has been certified as a Top Employer 2019 by the Top Employers Institute for its exceptional employee offerings!

We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine

Novartis are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.

[DublinAbout Us:
Want to join a company on the cutting edge of technology and travel? Want to be part of a fantastic and fun company that’s revolutionising the online travel advertising space?

Sojern works with 93% of the Fortune 500 travel companies and has spent more than a decade analyzing the complete traveler path to purchase. We drive travelers from dream to destination by activating multi-channel branding and performance solutions on the Sojern Traveler Platform for more than 8,500 customers around the world.

Sojern made Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500 list for the last 6 years in a row, and was recognised on the Top Company Cultures list by Entrepreneur Magazine and named a Best Place to Work by AdAge. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, with teams based in Dubai, Dublin, Hong Kong, Istanbul, London, Mexico City, New York, Omaha, Paris, Singapore, and Sydney.

Need more convincing that Sojern is a great place to work? Check out our Glassdoor reviews!

About the Team:
The Data Science Engineering team develops methods to optimize advertising campaigns, defines new methods for measuring campaign performance, and applies machine learning at scale with more than 5000 models in production. Example projects include:


Bayesian statistics to model conversion rates and revenue
Thompson sampling and linear programming to balance campaign objectives
Stratified sampling and power analysis to run controlled experiments
Using Tensorflow and XGBoost on Kubeflow to predict a traveler’s propensity to convert

And as a part of engineering, we own the full data product life-cycle: from analysis and prototyping to production development.

The Role:
We are looking for a Manager of Data Science to drive business, process and team impact with data science, team empowerment and collaboration.

Responsibilities:

Write production code in Python, and can reason about algorithmic efficiency.
Inspire with the way you authentically communicate with data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leadership.
Solve data science challenges and innovate in the context of trade-offs.
Coordinate, collaborate and delegate to make sure that products are successful.
Solid understanding of what drives the products that you work on.
Drive business impact by designing, architecting, implementing, and delivering data-driven products.
Ensure your team is successful with inclusivity, mentorship, feedback, recognition, and career goals.
Partner with product managers and engineering leadership to create clarity, positive change and improve technology strategy.
Prioritize company and team goals ahead of your own.
Champion diversity on the data science and engineering teams.
Serve as a multiplier helping the team be more than the sum of its parts.
Determination and initiative to fill in gaps and drive projects to completion.

What you bring to the table:

At least 6 years experience as a data scientist
At least 2 years of experience within the Ad Tech ecosystem
At least 2 years of experience managing (player/coach).
Hands-on experience building production-level ML and data products.
Expert-level understanding of data science topics.
Experience writing code and managing reports.
Experience applying agile methods to data science, and ideally have been a scrum master.
MS or PhD in computer science or a quantitative discipline.

Perks:

Culture: Strong core business values, focus on teamwork, vibrant, social and fun environment
Snacks: Variety of snacks in the office
Opportunities: Be part of a growing team with training and support to help you grow
Give Back: We give 40 hours a year to volunteer and organize office volunteer programs with local organizations
Ownership: Lead innovative and challenging projects
Competitive Localized Benefits
IATA travel discount
Time off: 25 vacation days per annum

At Sojern, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.]

[DublinAbout us:
In the words of Inc Magazine “Web Summit is the largest technology conference in the world”. Forbes says Web Summit is “the best tech conference on the planet”, Bloomberg calls it “Davos for geeks”, Politico “the Olympics of tech”, and the Guardian “Glastonbury for geeks”.

Whatever Web Summit is, it wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team of nearly 200 employees, including world class engineers, data scientists, designers, producers, marketers, salespeople and more.

We’ve disrupted an old industry by building incredible software and designing mind-blowing events. We’ve revolutionised how people come together in our world. We started with one event: Web Summit. But now we’re creating category defining events all over the world, from Asia to North America.

We’re just getting started!

About the team:
Web Summit Live Events Team is central to creating world-class attendee experience on a global scale. Designers, event coordinators, producers, stage managers and many others work hand in hand to produce all elements from stages to exhibitions through to live operations and attendee experience for Web Summit, RISE, f.ounders, Collision and many more of our events round the world.

What you’ll achieve at Web Summit:

You’ll work as part of the the team of event producers in the planning and delivery of our global events.
You’ll help create and produce a wide variety of activities at our events including conferences, VIP events, press conferences, night summit events.
You’ll work with venues, suppliers and contractors, negotiating rates and contracts.
You’ll research and find new opportunities for events in the global event cities

You’ll find and present creative solutions to event requirements
You'll work on planning multiple events across multiple countries simultaneously

Who you are:

You know that details matter and your attention to detail is exceptional.
You appreciate the importance of quality administrative support to the team before and after the event.
You like to self-motivate and you certainly don’t lack enthusiasm.
You’re a calm person, you stay level headed under pressure and you love a good challenge.
You’re a problem-solver with the ability to think on your feet, react rapidly to situations, prioritise your workload and implement measures to improve procedures and workflows.
You’re flexible and have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and pressurised environment, building and maintaining long-lasting relationships.
You have a lot of love for both startups/tech and events and have the willingness to work in an amazingly dedicated team.
Finally, you’re a confident and friendly person who cares about the experience of attendees.

Skills and abilities we’re looking for:

4-5 years experience in event planning, event production, event project management
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree with strong performance
Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively
Strong administrative skills and an ability to meet deadlines
Proven ability to manage multiple tasks at a time while paying strict attention to detail
Budget management and scheduling skills
Ambition and an ability to work on own initiative to accomplish tasks
Strong academic and extracurricular record.

Be healthy, curious and social:

Stay healthy with our fully subsidised healthcare cover.
Exercise your mind and body with our free gym membership and yoga.
Enjoy your own private garden

[https://websummit.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Web-Summit-garden-tramway-house-dublin-office.jpg]with an orchard, sports equipment, and vegetables right outside your office.

Enjoy an unlimited supply of fresh fruit, beverages, and cereals.
Master new skills from those around you, onsite talks and training initiatives.

[DublinAbout us:
In the words of Inc. magazine, “Web Summit is the largest technology conference in the world”. Forbes says Web Summit is “the best tech conference on the planet”, Bloomberg calls it “Davos for geeks”, Politico “the Olympics of tech”, and the Guardian “Glastonbury for geeks”.

Whatever Web Summit is it wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team of nearly 200 employees, including world class engineers, data scientists, designers, producers, marketers, salespeople and more.

We’ve disrupted an old industry by building incredible software and designing mind-blowing events. We’ve revolutionised how people come together in our world. We started with one event: Web Summit. But now we’re creating category defining events all over the world, from Asia to North America.

We’re just getting started!
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shSLieOZxjc&feature=youtu.be]

About the team:
Imagine working with the world’s best startups on a daily basis. From hardware, IoT and VR to advertising, ecommerce and analytics, our Startup Success team is right in the middle of a vast and vibrant startup community. They ensure a stellar experience before, during and after our events across the globe: Web Summit, Collision and RISE.

We act as dedicated points-of-contact for each and every startup, providing support, guidance and the keys to maximising the opportunities on offer at Web Summit - from exhibiting, to meeting investors and mentors, to attending talks and other highly curated and targeted events. For Web Summit 2019, as a team, we will support up to 2000 startups from around the world.

What you’ll achieve at Web Summit:

You’ll foster relationships with many of the world’s greatest and most innovative startups, actively catering for needs and requirements, and playing a key role in their event experience before, during and after.
You’ll act as a point-of-contact for startups and other teams. You'll provide administrative support, collect attendee information, produce event-specific documentation, curate content prior to the event, and ensure appropriate arrangements (POC, accommodations, marketing collateral, etc.) are made.
You’ll liaise with our in-house event producers and designers, supporting event execution and ensuring stellar startup experience.
You’ll produce weekly progress updates to plan and escalate any areas for improvement within your team.
You’ll promote knowledge-sharing and cross-team collaboration, and support other event initiatives on an ad-hoc basis, such as recruitment of mentors and judges.
You’ll work closely with the business intelligence team, monitoring, reviewing and updating the attendee database.

Who you are:

You’re a natural collaborator who excels as part of a large, multi-faceted team working towards stellar startup experience.
You’re a confident, friendly person who loves helping people one-to-one and at scale, and you certainly don’t lack in enthusiasm and positive attitude!
You can juggle multiple projects at once, providing solutions and optimising workflows within and outside of your direct role.
You’re a calm person and a problem-solver who thinks on your feet, reacts rapidly to situations, and prioritises workload in a pressurised environment.
You have a love of both startups/tech and events and have the drive to work in a hard-working and amazingly dedicated team.
You like to go above and beyond in delivering an exceptional experience to the people you deal with.

Skills and abilities we’re looking for:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree with a strong performance.
Exceptional administrative skills and an ability to meet moving deadlines on multiple projects at a time.
Prior experience in high volume client/campaign management and/or solid customer support.
Ambition and an ability to work on own initiative to accomplish high volume tasks.
Exceptional planning and scheduling skills with a sharp eye for detail.

Be healthy, curious and social:

Stay healthy with our fully subsidised healthcare cover.
Exercise your mind and body with our free gym membership and yoga.
Enjoy your own private garden

[https://blog.websummit.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/websummitgarden.jpg] with an orchard, sports equipment, and vegetables right outside your office.

Enjoy an unlimited supply of fresh fruit, beverages, and cereals.
Master new skills from those around you, onsite talks and training initiatives.
Become workmates, not just colleagues, with our active social calendar of company celebrations, trips abroad and sports.

]

[DublinWe’re searching for a growth-focused Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our expanding sales team. This is a unique opportunity to join a high-growth startup in an innovative and expanding technology space.

About AYLIEN:
AYLIEN is a content intelligence company based in Dublin, Ireland. We make it easy for companies like Sony and Microsoft to not only collect but truly understand large volumes of human-generated content on the web using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Natural Language Processing. Our Text Analysis and News APIs enable developers and data scientists to extract key business insights from massive amounts of content with extreme ease.

About the role:
Following a period of significant growth in our customer base we are further expanding our Sales team at AYLIEN and are currently on the lookout for experienced BDRs/Inside Sales Reps with 1-2 years experience in a prospecting role, to help bring the power of our content intelligence solutions to market. Our BDRs are central to our sales team’s success and will work directly with Account Executives to drive pipeline through inbound lead qualification and personalised outreach to AYLIEN’s target accounts.

Core Responsibilities:
Inbound lead qualification and nurturing:

Be the initial point of contact for all inbound leads
Qualify customer leads based on business need and technical fit
Create and manage business opportunities and pipeline from our inbound lead flow

Hunting for new business:

Outbound prospecting across various channels (phone, email, social)
Organisation mapping and target account investigation
Conduct high-volume prospecting calls with key target accounts
Contribute to generating and developing business opportunities in target accounts and verticals

Managing an effective sales process:

Make an existing tried and tested process yours
Maintain a diligent and detailed CRM process
Categorise and segment leads according to specific qualification criteria
Work closely with the rest of the Sales team in driving new business deals
Exceed daily and weekly KPI targets

Requirements:

Working at a startup brings new challenges every day, so you need the drive and desire to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
We want someone who gets excited by ambitious targets, so you must be competitive and strive to exceed measurable performance targets every day
We receive thousands of organic leads every month, so you must have a well-structured and process-driven approach to sales
We also deal with a wide range of customers from indie developers to C-level executives, so for that reason, we need someone with a consultative selling style
Strong organisational and time management skills are a must
You’ll be interacting with potential customers every day, so excellent written and verbal communication skills are required
You’ll be pitching complex solutions to a wide range of clients, so the ability to explain complex concepts in a simple way is very important
The ability to spot an opportunity (be that a sales prospect, a partnership, a strategic direction etc.) shows us you have the business acumen to contribute to what we’re building

Nice to haves:

Experience running customer demos
Experience working in a SaaS company
Experience in managing the entire sales process lead to close
Previous sales and prospecting experience in the data analytics space

What’s on offer?


It’s not often you get the chance to grow an established startup in a hot industry sector
Working at a company like AYLIEN gives you an incomparable insight into how a tech startup works and functions
We are backed by some of the most prominent and forward-thinking investors in Ireland who continue to support us and our growth at every step
We provide a range of great benefits:
Competitive salary package
Share options scheme
Laptop
Healthcare plan
Free fruit and healthy snacks in the office
Bike to work scheme
Travel tax saver scheme

Please note that this position is based in Dublin, Ireland and we are currently not considering remote employees for this position.]

Helping bring new theories and inventions to life and drive data innovation within Tenable

Explore and work with the cutting edge data processing technologies
Work in a lean environment building out a state of the art data science platform

[South Dublin, County DublinOverview
UL is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join the iON Compliance team in Dublin, Ireland.

iON Compliance is a big data platform combining data ingest, analytics, machine learning and elements of artificial intelligence within a data lake. iON is now looking to add a Machine Learning Engineer to our team to accelerate the growth of the most innovative UL digital technology investment in its history. Our goal is to enable the UL client base to effectively apply the recent developments in the digital revolution, by giving them the ability to truly leverage their own corpus of data with internal core competences and win in a rapidly evolving digital eco-system.
Responsibilities
Our ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about working with data and driven to deliver creative and compelling solutions which turn data into actionable information for our customers. We are seeking someone who is self-directed yet a team player to work with other teams bringing analytical capabilities as part of our product. As a key resource on our team you must possess strong interpersonal skills, maintain a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail and have excellent oral and written communication skills. The role will be responsible for designing and developing innovative analytical solutions, which drive business insights within our products. A solid foundation in machine learning and development best practices is a pre-requisite. You will work at the intersection of our data engineering, data science, and UX teams and help us build our evolving analytical platform.

Understand and use computer science fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, computability and complexity and computer architecture
Use exceptional mathematical skills, in order to perform computations and work with the algorithms involved in this type of programming
Produce project outcomes and isolate the issues that need to be resolved, in order to make programs more effective
Collaborate with data engineers and data scientists to build data and model pipelines
Manage the infrastructure and data pipelines needed to bring code to production
Demonstrate end-to-end understanding of applications (including, but not limited to, the machine learning algorithms) being created
Build algorithms based on statistical modelling procedures and build and maintain scalable machine learning solutions in production
Apply machine learning algorithms and libraries for problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development
Lead on software engineering and software design using machine learning services
Communicate and explain complex processes to people who are not programming experts
Liaise with stakeholders to analyze business problems, clarify requirements and define the scope of the resolution needed
Research and implement best practices to improve the existing machine learning infrastructure
Provide support to engineers and product managers in implementing machine learning in the product
Creating automated machine learning services/systems and constant tracking of its performance.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in Data Analytics, Data Science or Computer Science
A number of years’ experience in software development using Python and Shell Scripting
Proficiency in statistical, predictive modeling, machine learning with big data using tools like Python and R,.
Experience with optimization on state-of-the-art machine learning models.
Ability to write high quality production code for model deployment using CI/CD pipelines
Programming or scripting experience (e.g. Python, PowerShell, Java, or C#)
Experience using Big Data technologies (Spark, Cosmos, or Azure)
Detailed knowledge of machine learning evaluation metrics and best practice
Strong Python coding skills and problem-solving, good analytical & communication skills
Demonstrated effective interpersonal, influencing, collaboration and listening skills
Experience of working in an Agile environment & Agile Project Management
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Kubernetes, Azure Machine Learning Studio, Azure Cognitive Services]
